offers.name: Classic Upsell
offers.description: The simplest and fastest upsell to implement. Offer something free or heavily discounted just for buying. Works on front-end and back-end with 80%+ take rates when executed seamlessly.
key_success_factors: Make it seamless - customer barely notices they're buying more
Offer must feel like a no-brainer (free or heavy discount)
Can work with single product or multiple products
80%+ take rate is achievable when done right
when_it_fails: Upsell is clunky or requires too many steps

headlines: Special one-time offer for new customers
offer_structure: Immediately present upsell (same page or thank you page)
Offer something free or heavily discounted just for buying
Make it one-click to accept (card on file ideal)
80%+ should say yes if offer is right
implementation_tips: Keep it simple - one click to add
Make offer irresistible (free or 80%+ discount)
Test on front-end AND back-end
Works in automated funnels and sales calls
Example: 'Get [bonus product] FREE just for buying today'

offers.name: Menu Upsell
offers.description: The most sophisticated upsell strategy using 4 tactics: Unselling (tell them what they DON'T need), Prescribing (tell them what they DO need), A/B Offer (ask preference), and Card on File (make it easy). Builds trust and LTV.
key_success_factors: UNSELLING: Tell customers what they DON'T need (builds massive trust)
PRESCRIBING: Act like a doctor - diagnose and prescribe the right solution
A/B OFFER: Give 2 options and ask which they prefer (not 'yes or no')
CARD ON FILE: Make purchase frictionless with stored payment
Requires product variety to prescribe from
when_it_fails: Not enough products to prescribe from
No card on file makes friction too high

hard_disqualifiers.reason: Menu Upsell requires multiple products to prescribe from. With only one product, you can't use this strategy effectively.

headlines: Let me prescribe the right solution for you
Here's what I recommend based on your situation
You DON'T need [product X], but you DO need [product Y]
offer_structure: STEP 1 - UNSELLING: 'You don't need our premium package because...'
STEP 2 - PRESCRIBING: 'Based on what you told me, you need [specific product]'
STEP 3 - A/B OFFER: 'Would you prefer [Option A] or [Option B]?'
STEP 4 - CARD ON FILE: 'I'll add that to your account now' (one click)
implementation_tips: Works best on sales calls or live chat
Requires training team to prescribe, not sell
Build product matrix (if X situation, prescribe Y product)
Track which prescriptions lead to best LTV
Example: 'Most people think they need X, but in your case, Y is better because...'

offers.name: Anchor Upsell
offers.tagline: Show Premium First, Rescue with Main Offer
offers.description: Present the premium version FIRST at 5-10x the price. Wait for the gasp. Then 'rescue' them with your main offer. Customers end up spending more than they planned because the premium anchored their expectations.
best_for: Businesses that can create legitimate premium tiers
Sales calls where you can gauge reaction
Sophisticated buyers who appreciate premium value
key_success_factors: Premium must be 5-10x more expensive than main offer
Premium must be LEGITIMATE value (not fake tier)
Present premium first with full enthusiasm
Wait for 'the gasp' reaction to high price
Come to rescue: 'I have something more affordable...'
Main offer now feels like a bargain
when_it_fails: Premium tier feels fake or inflated
Price anchoring doesn't work in your market
metrics_to_track: Average order value vs. main offer alone
Premium tier take rate (should be low, 5-15%)
Main offer conversion after seeing premium

hard_disqualifiers.reason: Anchor Upsell requires creating a premium tier at 5-10x price. If you can't create legitimate premium value, this strategy won't work.
Anchor Upsell works best at higher price points. With sub-$50 offers, creating a credible 5-10x premium is challenging.

headlines: Let me show you our premium solution
We have two ways we can help you...
Our VIP program includes everything you need
offer_structure: STEP 1: Present PREMIUM offer first (5-10x main offer price)
STEP 2: Explain full value of premium with enthusiasm
STEP 3: State premium price clearly and confidently
STEP 5: 'I have something more affordable that might work better...'
STEP 6: Present main offer (now feels like bargain)
implementation_tips: Works best on sales calls (need to see reaction)
Premium MUST be legitimate 5-10x value
Don't apologize for premium price
Some will buy premium (5-15%) - bonus profit
Main offer conversion increases because of anchor
Example: Present $10k VIP first, then rescue with $2k program

offers.name: Rollover Upsell
offers.tagline: Credit Previous Purchases Toward Next Offer
offers.description: The most-used upsell by Hormozi. Credit what customers already paid toward a higher-priced next offer (at least 4x higher). Works in 4 situations: re-engaging old customers, rescuing upset customers, stealing competitors' upset customers, or upselling current customers.
best_for: Established customer base with purchase history
key_success_factors: MUST track customer purchase history accurately
Next offer should be at least 4x higher than credit amount
Works in 4 scenarios: re-engage old, rescue upset, steal competitors', upsell current
Frame as 'we'll credit what you paid toward this bigger solution'
Turns sunk cost into investment toward next level
when_it_fails: Next offer isn't valuable enough (needs to be 4x+ credit)
Customers don't see value in upgrading
metrics_to_track: Average credit amount vs. upsell value

hard_disqualifiers.reason: Rollover Upsell requires accurate purchase history tracking to credit previous purchases. Without tracking, you can't execute this strategy.
Rollover Upsell works with established customers who have purchase history. New businesses with few customers don't have the base to roll over.

headlines: We'll credit everything you paid toward [premium offer]
Don't let your investment go to waste
Upgrade and we'll roll over your previous purchase
offer_structure: SITUATION 1 - RE-ENGAGE OLD: 'You paid $X before. Roll that into $4X program'
SITUATION 2 - RESCUE UPSET: 'Not happy? Credit toward better solution'
SITUATION 3 - STEAL COMPETITORS': 'Paid competitor $X? We'll credit that'
SITUATION 4 - UPSELL CURRENT: 'You've invested $X, upgrade for just $3X more'
implementation_tips: Track every customer purchase meticulously
Next offer must be at least 4x credit amount
Frame as 'don't lose your investment'
Works in emails, calls, or automated sequences
Example: 'You paid $500 for course. Credit that toward $2,500 coaching program'
Most-used upsell by Hormozi for a reason

recommendation_logic.scoring_explanation: Each offer is scored based on how well the user's answers align with that offer's ideal use case. Scores are normalized (total_score / max_possible_score) to produce a confidence rating between 0 and 1.
recommendation_logic.hard_disqualifier_explanation: Some answers automatically disqualify certain offers (e.g., no purchase tracking disqualifies Rollover Upsell). These are marked as 'disqualified' in results.
